action.action-desc: Ms. Eshoo introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To repeal debt collection amendments made by the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2015, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Help Americans Never Get Unwanted Phone Calls Act of 2018 or the HANGUP Act.

section.header: Repeal of debt collection amendments; clarifying coverage with respect to government contractors

subsection.text: The Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 151 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 3, by striking paragraph (39) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: includes an individual, partnership, association, joint-stock company, trust, or corporation; and
for the purposes of section 227, includes a contractor of the United States Government with respect to a call that is made solely to collect a debt owed to or guaranteed by the United States.

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)(iii), by striking , unless such call is made solely to collect a debt owed to or guaranteed by the United States; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking , is made solely pursuant to the collection of a debt owed to or guaranteed by the United States,; and
in subparagraph (F)(ii), by adding and at the end;
in subparagraph (G)(ii), by striking ; and at the end and inserting a period; and

subsection.text: Section 301(b) of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2015 (47 U.S.C. 227 note; Public Law 114–74) is repealed.
